sentences.sentence: A bath at Baker Street freshened me up( 焕然一新 ) wonderfully.
When I came down to our room I found the breakfast ready and Holmes pouring out the coffee.
“Here it is,” said he, laughing, and pointing to an open newspaper.
“The energetic Jones and the hard-working reporter have arranged it between them. But you have had enough of the case. Better have your ham and eggs first.”
I took the paper from him and read the article, which was headed “Mysterious( 神秘的 ) Business at Upper Norwood.”
About twelve o’clock last night [said the Standard] Mr. Bartholomew Sholto, of Pondicherry Lodge, Upper Norwood, was found dead in his room under circumstances which point to murder.
As far as we can learn, no actual traces( 迹象 ) of violence were found upon Mr. Sholto’s person,
but a valuable collection of Indian jewels which the gentleman had inherited( 继承 ) from his father has been carried off.
The discovery was first made by Mr. Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson, who had called at the house with Mr. Thaddeus Sholto, brother of the dead man.
By a piece of good fortune, the well-known detective Mr. Athelney Jones happened to be at the Norwood Police Station, and was on the scene( 到现场 ) within half an hour.
His trained and experienced abilities were at once directed towards the detection of the criminals,
with the happy result that the brother, Thaddeus Sholto, has already been arrested,
together with the housekeeper, Mrs. Bernstone, an Indian servant named Lal Rao, and a porter, or gatekeeper, named McMurdo.
It is quite certain that the thief or thieves were well acquainted with( 对...熟悉 ) the house,

for Mr. Jones’s well-known technical knowledge and his powers of minute observation have enabled( 使能够 ) him to prove conclusively( 确凿地 ) that the criminals could not have entered by the door or by the window,
but must have gone across the roof of the building, and so through a trap door( 通气门 ) into a room which communicated with that in which the body was found.
This proves that it was no mere random( 偶然的 ) burglary.
The prompt( 迅速的 ) and energetic action of the police shows the great advantage of the presence on such occasions of a single powerful and masterful mind.
“Isn’t it wonderful!” said Holmes, grinning( 咧嘴笑 ) over his coffee-cup. “What do you think of it?”
“I think that we ourselves were lucky not to be arrested for the crime.”
“So do I. I wouldn’t rely on our safety now, if he should happen to have another of his attacks of energy.”
“Well, time to rest now. Toby can eat the leftovers from our breakfast. Are you going to bed, Holmes?”
“No, I am not tired. I never remember feeling tired by work, though idleness( 无所事事 ) exhausts( 使疲惫不堪 ) me completely.
I am going to smoke and to think over this queer( 奇怪的 ) business to which my fair client( 客户 ) has introduced us.
If ever man had an easy task, this of ours ought to be.
Wooden-legged men are not so common, but the other man must, I should think, be absolutely unique.”
“That other man again!”
“I have no wish to make a mystery( 谜 ) of him to you, anyway. But you must have formed your own opinion.
Now, do consider the data. Tiny footmarks, naked( 赤裸的 ) feet, stone-headed wooden club, great agility( 灵活 ), small poisoned darts( 刺 ). What do you make of all this?”
“A savage!” I exclaimed( 惊呼 ). “Perhaps one of those Indians who were the associates of Jonathan Small.”
“Hardly that,” said he. “When first I saw signs of strange weapons( 武器 ) I was inclined( 倾向于 ) to think so; but the remarkable character of the footmarks caused me to reconsider my views.
Some Indians are small men, but none could have left such marks as that.
Hindus have long and thin feet. Sandal( 凉鞋 )-wearing Mohammedans have the big toe( 脚趾 ) well separated from the others.
These little darts( 刺 ), too, could only be shot in one way. They are from a blow-pipe( 吹箭筒 ).
Now, then, where are we to find our savage?”
“South America,” I hazarded( 冒昧提出 ).
He stretched( 伸出 ) his hand up, and took down a bulky( 巨大的 ) volume( 书籍 ) from the shelf.
“This is the first volume( 卷 ) of an atlas( 地图集 ) which is now being published. It may be looked upon as the very latest authority( 权威 ). What have we here?
Andaman Islands, situated 340 miles to the north of Sumatra, in the Bay of Bengal.
Hum( 哼声 )! hum( 哼声 )! What’s all this? Moist( 潮湿的 ) climate, coral reefs( 礁体 ), sharks, Port Blair, prison camp, Rutland Island, cottonwood( 棉白杨 ) trees—Ah, here we are.
The natives of the Andaman Islands may perhaps claim the distinction of being the smallest race upon this earth.
The average height is rather below four feet, although many full-grown adults may be found who are very much smaller than this.
They are a fierce people, though capable( 能够的 ) of forming most devoted friendships when their confidence has once been gained.
Notice that, Watson. Listen to this.
They are naturally hideous( 极难看的 ), having large, misshapen( 畸形的 ) heads, small, fierce eyes, and distorted( 扭曲的 ) features( 面貌特征 ).
Their feet and hands, however, are remarkably small.
So fierce and wild are they that all the efforts of the British have failed to civilize them.
They have always been a terror to shipwrecked( 遭受海难的 ) crews, killing the survivors with their stone-headed clubs, or shooting them with their poisoned arrows.
These massacres( 屠杀 ) always end with a cannibal( 食人族 ) feast.
Friendly people, Watson! I imagine that, the way things turned out, Jonathan Small would much prefer not to have employed him.”
“But how did he happen to have so unusual a companion?”
“Since we have already determined that Small had come from the Andamans, it is not so surprising that this islander should be with him.
No doubt we shall know all about it in time.
Look here, Watson; you look exhausted( 精疲力竭的 ). Lie down there on the sofa, and see if I can put you to sleep.”
He took up his violin from the corner, and as I stretched myself out( 躺下 ) he began to play some low, dreamy, melodious( 悦耳的 ) tune.
I seemed to be floating peacefully away upon a soft sea of sound, until I found myself in the land of dreams, with the sweet face of Mary Morstan looking down upon me.

article_info.previous: Holmes和Watson去码头旁租船的屋子打探情况，了解到Jonathan Small正是伙同了这家男主人一起逃跑，他们驾驶了一艘名叫“Aurora”的汽艇离开，这让事情变得棘手。经过一整夜的追捕，Holmes决定他们应该先回去休息再采取进一步行动。
article_info.share_words: “I have no wish to make a mystery of him to you, anyway. But you must have formed your own opinion. Now, do consider the data. Tiny footmarks, naked feet, stone-headed wooden club, great agility, small poisoned darts. What do you make of all this?” “A savage!” I exclaimed.

question.cn: Jones对这起案件的看法是否不出所料地出现在了报纸上呢？
question.en: Did Jones’s view of the case appear in the newspaper as expected?

analysis: 文中提到：“‘Here it is,’said he, laughing, and pointing to an open newspaper.‘The energetic Jones and the hard-working reporter have arranged it between them. . . ’”因此答案选A。

question.en: What was Holmes going to do after the breakfast?

options.en: He was going to keep on working.
He was going to take care of the dog.

analysis: 文中提到：“No, I am not tired. I never remember feeling tired by work, though idleness exhausts me completely. I am going to smoke and to think over this queer business to which my fair client has introduced us. ”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 从已有的关于另一个同伙的信息中，可以推断出什么？
question.en: What could be inferred from the information collected about the other man?

options.cn: 这个人是个孩子或者女性。
options.en: It was a child or a woman.

analysis: 文中Holmes列举了有关于这个同伙的信息：“Now, do consider the data. Tiny footmarks, naked feet, stone-headed wooden club, great agility, small poisoned darts. What do you make of all this?” Watson回答道：“A savage!”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Jonathan Small是如何能获得这样一位非比寻常的同伴的呢？
question.en: How could Jonathan Small have so unusual a companion?

options.cn: 他和这个同伴是在印度结下了友谊。
options.en: He established friendship with the companion in India.

options.cn: 他给了这个同伴很多的钱。
options.en: He paid the companion a lot of money.

options.cn: 他曾在Andaman岛做囚犯，在那儿他结识了这位岛民。
options.en: He used to be a convict in Andamans and met the islander there.

analysis: 文中提到：“Since we have already determined that Small had come from the Andamans, it is not so surprising that this islander should be with him.”因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第36天
